questions.question_text: Which of the following controls BEST ensures the integrity of data exchanged between two systems?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
While encryption can protect the confidentiality of data during transmission, it doesn't inherently guarantee its integrity. Hash values specifically address the integrity aspect by providing a means to detect any unauthorized changes to the data.

Selected Answer: B
Encryption the right answer. Only authorized parties with the decryption key can access the original data. This ensures that even if someone intercepts the data during exchange, they cannot understand or alter it.

questions.question_text: An IS auditor detects that event logging has been disabled on a critical server. Which of the following is the GREATEST concern?

choices.A: Users have the ability to disable logging.
choices.B: Organizational policies do not prohibit disabling of event logs.
choices.C: The ability to troubleshoot incidents is limited.
Document the findings in the audit report.
choices.D: Communicate the observation to the auditee.
choices.A: Escalate the situation to the lead auditor.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Communicate the observation to the auditee.

Selected Answer: D
While options such as escalating the situation to the lead auditor (option A) may be necessary in certain circumstances, it's generally advisable to start by communicating the observation to the auditee. This allows the organization to respond to the findings and take appropriate actions promptly.

Selected Answer: D
Before issuing an audit report, the auditor works with the auditee to verify the facts of the findings.

Selected Answer: C
Prior to issuing an audit report, auditor review the facts of our findings with the auditee.

D. Communicate the observation to the auditee.

Documenting the findings in the audit report is essential, but it should come after communicating the observations to the auditee. The auditee should have an opportunity to respond or take corrective action before the findings are formally documented.

Selected Answer: C
C makes most sense to me.

questions.question_text: An IS auditor has identified deficiencies within the organization's software development life cycle policies. Which of the following should be done NEXT?
Which of the following is MOST important for an IS auditor to confirm when reviewing an organization's incident response management program?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
While assigning severity levels to incidents (option D) is an important aspect of incident response management, it is secondary to the ability to detect incidents in the first place. Without effective detection capabilities, the organization may struggle to appropriately assess and prioritize incidents based on their severity levels. Therefore, ensuring that alerting tools and the incident response team can detect incidents should take precedence during the audit of an organization's incident response management program.

choices.A: All identified incidents are escalated to the CEO and the CISO.
choices.D: All incidents have a severity level assigned.
choices.B: The alerting tools and incident response team can detect incidents.
choices.C: Incident response is within defined service level agreements (SLAs).

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A risk-based audit strategy prioritizes areas where the organization is most vulnerable to risk. Since business processes are the foundation of organizational operations and objectives, focusing on these processes ensures the audit is aligned with the areas of highest importance and risk to the business. This makes A the best choice.

Selected Answer: C
This should be C. when doing a risk based audit the focus should be main or critical things to the business. This way you can do proper resource allocation and ensure critical applications remain safe and functional as they are the most important things to the business.
